channel.title: MySQL Problem
channel.description: I'm rather new to web development and I'm currently working on MySQL database, I'm not sure if I'm allowed to post this here but how would I go about initializing a username inside of a table ( which I'm sure is probably a very nooby question)?

item.title: MySQL Problem
item.dc:creator: @mike4ever mike4ever
item.description:
@mike4ever wrote:

[quote=“RSCShadow, post:6, topic:478035”][quote author=mike4ever link=topic=596231.msg4198030#msg4198030 date=1357787750]

Depending on how your table is set up it will look similar to this.

INSERT INTO 'administrators'
VALUES('username', 'password', 'otherinfo', 'etc', 'etc')

Or like this if you prefer

Both commands do pretty much the same thing.

What would the function be?
[/quote]What language are you doing this in?[/quote]
Java & Newty Completely answered everything with that link, Thank You , Now to remove that other post I made lol.

Read full topic

item.title: MySQL Problem
item.dc:creator: @NewbieNewty Newty
item.description:
@NewbieNewty wrote:

[quote=“mike4ever, post:5, topic:478035”][quote author=Newty link=topic=596231.msg4198026#msg4198026 date=1357787631]
Depending on how your table is set up it will look similar to this.

INSERT INTO 'administrators'
VALUES('username', 'password', 'otherinfo', 'etc', 'etc')

Or like this if you prefer

Both commands do pretty much the same thing.
[/quote]

What would the function be?[/quote]

Sorry, I thought you were asking how to manually insert them via phpmyadmin or something similar.

If you are using java then the easiest way is to use a jdbc driver: http://www.roseindia.net/jdbc/jdbc-mysql/InsertValues.shtml

Read full topic
